required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: What is the Gold Standard of Airway Management in the Anticipated Difficult Airway
clinical_study.official_title: Survey on the Current Significance of the Flexible Endoscopy as the Gold Standard for Airway Management in Patients With Anticipated Difficult Airway

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective Observationalstudie to analyze the current significance of the awake flexible endoscopy in German hospitals.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of the study is to analyze the current significance of the awake flexible endoscopy in German hospitals, to identify strategies to securing the airway in patients with a anticipated difficult airway. The participants complete a pre-prepared questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: What is the current practice for Airway Management in patients with a anticipated difficult airway?
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the current practice to secure the airway in patients with a anticipated difficult airway

secondary_outcome.measure: What is the most preferred technique for awake flexible endoscopy?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 minutes

intervention.intervention_name: Airway Management in patients with a anticipated difficult airway
intervention.description: survey of anesthesists and intensive care physician of the perfomans with the flexible endoscope in patients with a anticipated difficult airway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- experience in anesthesia or intensive care
Exclusion Criteria:
- no

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology,Prof. C. Werner, Universit√§tsmedizin of the JG University
